programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sebastian's: Gordon Ramsay visits Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Los Angeles. The customers are scarce and the debt is mounting. Can Gordon turn the restaurant's fortunes around?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Finn McCool's: Gordon Ramsay visits Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, where the family feuding has got out of hand. Can Gordon mediate?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Olde Stone Mill: Gordon Ramsay visits The Olde Stone Mill in Tuckahoe, New York. The restaurant has been restored, but owner Dean cannot get customers through the door.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK:...
programme.desc: ...Reunion Special: Brand new: Fan faves from 2023 and 2024 reunite for a cosy country getaway. But it wouldn't be a MAFS reunion without a drama-fuelled dinner party and the Honesty Box...

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Rothman Disintegration: Sheldon and Kripke argue over who should get Professor Rothman's vacant corner office. Amy buys Penny some art to celebrate their friendship.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Werewolf Transformation: Sheldon's well-organised world is turned upside down when he learns that the barber who has cut his hair for years is ill in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Weekend Vortex: Amy is upset when Sheldon breaks his promise to attend her aunt's birthday party in order to join the guys for a Star Wars video game marathon instead.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Transporter Malfunction: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek memorabilia, but she is irked when they refuse to remove the toys from their packaging.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hawking Excitation: When Stephen Hawking comes to lecture at the university, Howard is given the task of maintaining his wheelchair, which makes Sheldon envious.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Stag Convergence: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj throw a bachelor party for Howard, during which some stories about his sexual history are accidentally revealed.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: Transformania
programme.desc: (2022) More madcap monster-based animated escapades, with Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez's voices. Ever wondered what an ancient vampire would look like if he were human? Wonder no more.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In the Name of the Grandfather: Homer takes the family to Ireland so that Grampa can visit quaint village pub O'Flanagan's one last time.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Wedding for Disaster: Homer and Marge discover that they're not officially married when Reverend Lovejoy finds out he wasn't a licensed minister at the time of their ceremony.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe: Homer takes Maggie to Moe's and leaves her in the playground outside the bar. Meanwhile, Moe is delighted to get to know a young woman online.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly: A volunteer inspires Bart to become a better person. Lisa writes an essay about what Springfield will be like in 50 years.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Father Knows Worst: Marge finds a sauna in the basement but doesn't tell anyone about it. Homer decides to get more involved in the children's education.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Do Pizza Bots Dream of Electric Guitars: New episodes come to E4. Homer tries to reunite a band from his youth, but J.J. Abrams gets hold of them first.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Manger Things: New episodes come to E4. A secret from Flanders' past is revealed, and we discover a room in the Simpsons home that we've never seen before.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: (2018) Tense horror starring John Krasinski and Emily Blunt. A family struggle to survive when the world's overrun by vicious blind aliens who can hear even the slightest whimper.

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK:...
programme.desc: ...Reunion Special: Brand new: Fan faves from 2023 and 2024 reunite for a cosy country getaway. But it wouldn't be a MAFS reunion without a drama-fuelled dinner party and the Honesty Box...

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time, The Late Late Show with James Corden, Married at First Sight Australia, Drawers Off, Your Honor, Million Pound Pawn, Pooch Perfect, and Stand Up & Deliver.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Paul is desperate to find love but worries that nerves make his stammer worse. And do chat-up lines work?

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex...
programme.desc: ...Experiment: Jess and Ben explore a non-monogamous lifestyle in the hot tub with Olivia and Gage, where Jess faces a big fear. And Kirsty and Tom consider attending a huge orgy.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Self-confessed 'dating disaster' Katie from Bristol wants to turn her luck around. Student James has a thing for heels and glitter, and hopes to meet an open-minded guy.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Nancy fears that she can't trust Darren, and he only makes matters worse. Cleo and Ste team up to get answers, while Maxine confronts her boyfriend, and Jez has a confession to make...

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren thinks he's been set up, but he only makes matters worse. Maxine confronts her boyfriend after sensing that he's hiding something. And Cleo and Ste team up to get answers.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Lucas fears that his boyfriend has fallen in with the wrong crowd. Grace sets a trap to catch the mole. And Jez has a confession to make...

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister, Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorbike and bicycle variety.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Finn McCool's: Gordon Ramsay visits Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, where the family feuding has got out of hand. Can Gordon mediate?

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: The Circle of Driving: First episode of the US comedy about 11-year-old Adam documenting his life in 1980s suburbia with his parents' video camera. Barry wants driving lessons.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Daddy Daughter Day: A day out with Erica at the roller-skating rink leaves Murray wishing that he hadn't asked his daughter to confide in him about her life.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Recombination Hypothesis: In the 100th episode of the US sitcom, Leonard and Penny agree to give their relationship another chance, but they soon start to argue again.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Beta Test Initiation: Leonard and Penny put their relationship through a 'beta test' and report problems with each other as 'bugs'. Sheldon and Amy seek internet fame.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Graduation: After graduating from high school, Sheldon struggles to cope when he realises that he may not be ready for college.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Docent, a Little Lady and a Bouncer Named Dalton: Sheldon gets his dream summer job at the local train museum. And Georgie discovers Mary's guilty pleasure.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: My Funky Valentine: Phil and Claire break from their traditional Valentine's Day dinner date and plan a little role play excursion. And Jay and Gloria's ideas of romance clash.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fears: When Phil and Luke embark on a discovery expedition underneath the house, Phil tries not to let his fear of the dark and of creepy crawlies get the best of him.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Truth Be Told: After reconnecting on Facebook, Phil invites his old high school girlfriend to drop by the house, but this friendly visit quickly turns into trouble.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Military Miniaturization: Howard has a meeting with Air Force representative Colonel Williams about the gyroscope he invented with Leonard and Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Dependence Transcendence: Tensions rise when the guys struggle to complete their Air Force project on time and are forced to work around the clock.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cohabitation Experimentation: When Amy's flat is flooded, she has to move out while it is being repaired and proposes a 'cohabitation experiment' with Sheldon.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Pager, a Club and a Cranky Bag of Wrinkles: Dr Linkletter pushes Sheldon to make friends with his fellow students, and Georgie gets a pager.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Box of Treasure and the Meemaw of Science: Sheldon, Dr Linkletter and Meemaw team up on a science experiment. And Georgie has a new side hustle.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: We Need to Talk About Lily: Phil thinks he's found Pepper's dream home. Mitch and Cam get invited to an exclusive event.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: SuperShowerBabyBowl: Jay is hosting a Super Bowl party, while Claire hosts a baby shower for Haley - and they're both at Jay's house. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Wettest Stories Ever Told: When the Simpsons' plans for a meal at The Frying Dutchman are ruined, they try to salvage the night by telling three tales of disaster at sea.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pray Anything: Jealous of Flanders' lifestyle, Homer starts to pray for material possessions, but things get out of hand when he asks for a bigger house and gets the church.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic-Con Conundrum: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj appoints Sheldon to organise his finances. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Escape Hatch Identification: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj when he's forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Fluctuation: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, and Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's professional life.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Waverly Hills, 9-0-2-1-D'oh: The family rent a flat in the affluent Waverly Hills area so that Bart and Lisa can get into a good school.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Lucas takes matters into his own hands in a bid to save his boyfriend, while concerns grow for Ste. Elsewhere, a family panic when a child goes missing.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: My Funky Valentine: Phil and Claire break from their traditional Valentine's Day dinner date and plan a little role play excursion. And Jay and Gloria's ideas of romance clash.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Old Yeller Belly: Santa's Little Helper becomes Duff Beer's new mascot after he's banished from the Simpson home for failing to save Homer from a tree house fire.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brake My Wife, Please: When Homer is banned from driving, Marge gets stressed ferrying everyone around, but Homer enjoys walking everywhere - until Marge crashes into him.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: MAFS Aus is back, and the weddings start straight away. Carina and Paul hope for love, but Eliot worries that he might not like his bride, Lauren.

programme.title: Nightmare Alley
programme.desc: (2021) Guillermo del Toro's star-studded carny thriller with Bradley Cooper and Cate Blanchett. Can a chancer with a dark past use clairvoyancy to fleece rich New Yorkers out of a fortune?

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2019) Action-thriller sequel. Secret agent Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) goes on the run when he's framed for an attack on the President. Can he clear his name?

programme.title: Cold War
programme.desc: (2018) Award-winning drama. A musical director and a singer fall in love but are maybe doomed to be separated by differing loyalties across the Iron Curtain. In Polish/subs. Sexual scenes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
programme.desc: (2003) Family comedy with Mike Myers. A badly behaved boy and his super-organised sister are plunged into an anarchic adventure when a man-sized talking cat suddenly appears at their home.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: (2014) Part-animated action-comedy with Megan Fox. Can four six-foot, super-powered mutant turtles that were once journalist April O'Neil's pets save New York from the Foot Clan?

programme.title: Enemy Mine
programme.desc: (1985) Sci-fi adventure starring Dennis Quaid and Louis Gossett Jr. A human and his alien enemy find themselves stranded alone on a hostile planet, where they must work together to survive.

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: (2003) Jack Black cranks the comedy up to 11. A slacker rock musician blags his way into a posh school and enrols a bunch of 10-year-olds into a full-scale Battle of the Bands.

programme.title: Suffragette Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer Abi Morgan, director Sarah Gavron and star Anne-Marie Duff talk about their powerful period political drama Suffragette.

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy-drama with Liam Neeson. An estranged father and son team up to fix up and sell an old Tuscan villa that their late wife and mother left to them.

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: (1999) Drama with Tom Hanks and Michael Clarke Duncan. Strange events occur when a man convicted of raping and murdering two young girls arrives on death row in a Louisiana prison.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: (2019) Supernatural horror. A nurse downloads an app which predicts that she'll be dead within days. As she uncovers its demonic roots, can she change her fate? Violence.

programme.title: Deerskin
programme.desc: (2019) Comedy horror. A middle-aged man (Jean Dujardin) buys a deerskin jacket to kick off his post-divorce life. Fine - until the jacket starts talking to him...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: Ferdinand
programme.desc: (2017) Charming animated bovine road movie from the makers of Ice Age. A huge but gentle bull (voiced by John Cena) tries to get home after being sent away to a bull fighting ranch.

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1973) Can Sinbad stop a master magician from reaching the Fountain of Destiny on the lost land of Lemuria and being crowned the new leader of Marabia?

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: (1995) Classic 90s high-school re-imagining of Jane Austen's Emma. Two fashion-obsessed pals (Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash) transform a new girl (Brittany Murphy) but create a monster.

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: (2015) Drama exploring the increasingly defiant campaign by British women for equality and the right to vote in the years before WWI. Starring Carey Mulligan.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly comic sci-fi action thriller with Michelle Yeoh. A laundromat owner's drab existence becomes much more exciting when she must traverse the multiverse to defeat an evil force.

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: (1989) Matthew Broderick, Denzel Washington and Morgan Freeman star in Edward Zwick's epic, Oscar-winning tribute to the first black regiment raised in the North during the Civil War.

programme.title: The Killing of Two Lovers
programme.desc: (2020) Tense, brooding drama. A husband and father estranged from his wife struggles with the feeling that he should do something drastic to keep his family.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: BSL Zone: Small World
programme.desc: Sitcom. Nothing stays the same in Small World - there are going to be some changes in the flat. Ep5/5.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: (1953) Audrey Hepburn won her only Oscar in this romance as a bored princess who runs away from her duties and meets an American journalist (Gregory Peck), who shows her Rome.

programme.title: Destroyer
programme.desc: (1943) Second World War drama about a warship assigned to mail runs but that ends up engaged in battle anyway, starring Edward G Robinson, Glenn Ford and Marguerite Chapman.

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2
programme.desc: (2017) Comedy sequel with Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow. There's trouble in store for the extended family when Dusty and Brad's fathers visit for Christmas.

programme.title: The Last Duel
programme.desc: (2021) Historical drama from director Ridley Scott. Trial by combat is the only option to save a noblewoman's honour. With Jodie Comer, Matt Damon, Adam Driver and Ben Affleck.

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The bad boyfriends enter the next phase of Olivia's project, 'Forgiveness and Moving Forwards'. Sam and Bayley are left sweating when Olivia asks them to hand over their phones.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: Model and actress Rosie Huntington-Whiteley joins the panel as a guest judge while Britain's best amateur clothing designers compete to win a job as a fashion designer at high street giant M&S. The designers tackle the challenges that come along with Lingerie Week

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: Judi's next stop is to the Greek seaside town of Parga where she meets Panayiotis and his family at their baker where she tries a traditional Greek coffee and learns to make feta and olive bread. Father and son duo, Kosmas and Giorgos, teach Judi about the many different uses of olive oil and Elinda takes the comedian on a trip around her herb and fruit gardens. Back on the yacht, Judi makes chargrilled vegetables with halloumi and a chilli mint dressing

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Felicity Kendal, Nigel Havers and Jessica Hynes join Alan and Meirion Owen gives a lesson in sheepdog training. Camilla Bassett-Smith and Chris Hull spruce up the green house and Ian Burrell makes rum cocktails for all seasons

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Dan Ryan and Leanne Best into his own home to talk about their roles in the new series of The Bay and trial recipes from chefs Glynn Purnell, Kate Austen and Andres Alemany

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur shares her passion for good food and recipes for an aubergine and potato curry with fresh roti, a salmon and tomato curry and gooey brownies. Plus, a lesson in how to handle alpacas and a visit from a local chainsaw artist

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kelso
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Morebattle Hurdle in Kelso, plus National Hunt racing from Doncaster and Newbury. Analysis comes from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, with reports by Oli Bell and Natalie Green, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Karim Zeroual, Christopher Biggins, Ellie Leach and Des Clarke pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the revival of the game show in which office manager Shirley, financial management assistant Cameron and police investigation officer Adele compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as more performers take to the stage to try to impress judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and guest judge KSI, and secure their place in the live semi-finals

programme.title: The Brit Awards 2025
programme.desc: Comedian Jack Whitehall returns to host the ceremony for a fifth time, from London's O2 Arena, as the people of the music industry gather to celebrate another 12 months in pop. Those taking to the stage include Sabrina Carpenter, Jade, Myles Smith, the Last Dinner Party, Teddy Swims and Shaboozey

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Murder of Alice Ruggles: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: How a young woman was brutally killed by a calculating ex-boyfriend who used social media and the internet to stalk and torment his victim before taking her life in her Newcastle home - with previously unseen social media correspondence between Alice and her friends, family and the perpetrator, this documentary explores how cyberstalking eventually led to murder

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Leeds United v West Bromwich Albion at Elland Road, Oxford United v Coventry City at Kassam Stadium, and Luton Town v Portsmouth at Kenilworth Road, in the Championship

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay challenges the teams to create a delicious Italian dinner, assigning a kitchen at random to do so.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Lerato Umah-Shaylor and Freddy Forster in the kitchen garden of Blickling Hall in Norfolk to see who can create and cook the Dish Of The Day this time. Ainsley showcases cucumbers picked from the Blickling greenhouse as part of his chicken and cucumber noodle salad, Freddy's background in French cuisine is shown in his sea trout with chilli and strawberry butter sauce, and Lerato brings her expertise in traditional African cooking to a Ugandan rolex

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Eastbourne, where he plays Mum's the Word, the Leaning Tower of Poundsa and brand-new game Escalator Spectator, before finishing the series with one last round of In for a Penny

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as more performers take to the stage to try to impress judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and guest judge KSI, and secure their place in the live semi-finals

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Dan Ryan and Leanne Best into his own home to talk about their roles in the new series of The Bay and trial recipes from chefs Glynn Purnell, Kate Austen and Andres Alemany

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Philip Glenister, Jenny Agutter and Renee Bailey join Alan in the barn and Dr Bolu Eso meets some famous dog breeds. Jamie Butterworth plants some early spring shrubbery and Becky Paskin makes some Old Hollywood cocktails

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team come to the aid of Penny and Carl in Leeds, whose devotion to looking after wildlife, including an endangered hedgehog, has taken over their garden. The team get to work creating a wildlife-friendly space that will also be suitable for the children to play in, and at the bottom of the garden, David Domoney designs a wildflower meadow complete with hedgehog-friendly pond

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Newcastle United v Brighton & Hove Albion (Kick-off 1.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at St James' Park. Newcastle have defeated two lower-league teams so far in this competition in Bromley and Birmingham City and will be looking to move a step closer to another cup final, having already reached the showpiece match in the Carabao Cup. However, they face a Brighton side who have not always been consistent this term, but can be a threat to anyone on their day, as demonstrated in their 1-0 win here in the Premier League in October. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, reports by Gabriel Clarke, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed game show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Catherine Tyldesley, Levi Roots, Chris McCausland and Rick Wakeman pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the four remaining celebrities take to the ice alone for the first time to fight for a place in the grand final. Diversity performs

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Crime drama set in Morecambe, following police officers as they untangle the complexities of criminal cases while also trying to help the families and individuals caught up in them. DS Jenn Townsend returns to work following her father's death and has to push her own grief aside as she investigates the murder of a young woman

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Oscars Live
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross hosts full coverage of the 97th Academy Awards, joined by guests including actor Jacon Isaacs, broadcaster Mariella Frostrup and film expert Elle Osili-Wood. Jonathan also presents footage from the red carpet at the Dolby Theatre in LA with Ross King, before the live ceremony begins at midnight, UK time, hosted by US TV host and comedian Conan O'Brien

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Yvonne Cobb and Rupy Aujla at Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day this time. Ainsley collects greengages and plums for his brioche French toast, chargrilled plums and cinnamon creme fraiche, Yvonne adds delicious flavour hacks to a creamy tarragon chicken and French bean salad with roasted rosemary potatoes, and Rupy talks up the health benefits of his grilled mackerel, roasted apple, radish and chilli and pea pesto

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix embarks on a gastronomic cycling tour of Northern Ireland to discover the region's best-kept delicious secrets. He begins in the Mourne Mountains where he pushes himself to cycle up to Spelga Dam for the best panoramic views and fuels up with a traditional Ulster Fry

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are married couple Jon and Nicola, student housemates Caitlin and Emily, and bookmaker's manager Vicky and her partner Andy

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chris from Manchester, Julie from Solihull, Maggie from Llandudno and Ed from London pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn is horrified to realise that Kim knows about the affair, tensions are high between Marlon and April, and Cain is left distraught

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Max is sentenced for his crime, Sally hosts a dinner party, Ken refuses to add to Cassie's troubles, Andy confronts David with a knife, and birthday girl Jenny makes a drunken pass at Kit

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Jenn and the team worry that Manning released information from their enquiries to the public too soon when Hannah's boyfriend Cal is discovered near death. At home, tensions brew as Jenn tries to juggle the investigation and her relationship with Chris

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Heathrow readies itself for a flurry of passengers as it's announced that holidaymakers can travel to 12 new countries. To keep Britain safe - and to keep it as simple for passengers as possible - a new traffic light system has come into operation, dividing Heathrow's 206 destinations into colours. Passenger Service Manager Demi is tasked with helping the many confused passengers, including one very agitated granny-to-be who has been turned away from her flight and isn't going quietly. The airport police are also hard at work as Sergeant Dawson is on the search for a missing child in Terminal 2

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at British brands, including Dr Martens footwear and Wagon Wheels biscuits. Narrated by Jimmy Nail

The team get to work creating a wildlife-friendly space that will also be suitable for the children to play in, and at the bottom of the garden, David Domoney designs a wildflower meadow complete with hedgehog-friendly pond

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Newcastle United v Brighton & Hove Albion (Kick-off 1.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at St James' Park. Newcastle have defeated two lower-league teams so far in this competition in Bromley and Birmingham City and will be looking to move a step closer to another cup final, having already reached the showpiece match in the Carabao Cup. However, they face a Brighton side who have not always been consistent this term, but can be a threat to anyone on their day, as demonstrated in their 1-0 win here in the Premier League in October. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, reports by Gabriel Clarke, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist

programme.desc: Max is sentenced for his crime, Sally hosts a dinner party, Ken refuses to add to Cassie's troubles, Andy confronts David with a knife, and birthday girl Jenny makes a drunken pass at Kit

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Jenn and the team worry that Manning released information from their enquiries to the public too soon when Hannah's boyfriend Cal is discovered near death. At home, tensions brew as Jenn tries to juggle the investigation and her relationship with Chris

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Olivia Attwood's Bad Boyfriends
programme.desc: The bad boyfriends enter the next phase of Olivia's project, 'Forgiveness and Moving Forwards'. Sam and Bayley are left sweating when Olivia asks them to hand over their phones.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Cardiff for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: Judi's next stop is to the Greek seaside town of Parga where she meets Panayiotis and his family at their baker where she tries a traditional Greek coffee and learns to make feta and olive bread. Father and son duo, Kosmas and Giorgos, teach Judi about the many different uses of olive oil and Elinda takes the comedian on a trip around her herb and fruit gardens. Back on the yacht, Judi makes chargrilled vegetables with halloumi and a chilli mint dressing

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Heathrow readies itself for a flurry of passengers as it's announced that holidaymakers can travel to 12 new countries. To keep Britain safe - and to keep it as simple for passengers as possible - a new traffic light system has come into operation, dividing Heathrow's 206 destinations into colours. Passenger Service Manager Demi is tasked with helping the many confused passengers, including one very agitated granny-to-be who has been turned away from her flight and isn't going quietly. The airport police are also hard at work as Sergeant Dawson is on the search for a missing child in Terminal 2

programme.desc: Ant and Dec host as more performers take to the stage to try to impress judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and guest judge KSI, and secure their place in the live semi-finals

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef invites Dan Ryan and Leanne Best into his own home to talk about their roles in the new series of The Bay and trial recipes from chefs Glynn Purnell, Kate Austen and Andres Alemany

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Philip Glenister, Jenny Agutter and Renee Bailey join Alan in the barn and Dr Bolu Eso meets some famous dog breeds. Jamie Butterworth plants some early spring shrubbery and Becky Paskin makes some Old Hollywood cocktails

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team come to the aid of Penny and Carl in Leeds, whose devotion to looking after wildlife, including an endangered hedgehog, has taken over their garden. The team get to work creating a wildlife-friendly space that will also be suitable for the children to play in, and at the bottom of the garden, David Domoney designs a wildflower meadow complete with hedgehog-friendly pond

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Newcastle United v Brighton & Hove Albion (Kick-off 1.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the fifth-round tie at St James' Park. Newcastle have defeated two lower-league teams so far in this competition in Bromley and Birmingham City and will be looking to move a step closer to another cup final, having already reached the showpiece match in the Carabao Cup. However, they face a Brighton side who have not always been consistent this term, but can be a threat to anyone on their day, as demonstrated in their 1-0 win here in the Premier League in October. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, reports by Gabriel Clarke, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Ally McCoist

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed game show hosted by Ben Shephard, as plucky players and famous faces alike take on the machine for its £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Catherine Tyldesley, Levi Roots, Chris McCausland and Rick Wakeman pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the four remaining celebrities take to the ice alone for the first time to fight for a place in the grand final. Diversity performs

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Crime drama set in Morecambe, following police officers as they untangle the complexities of criminal cases while also trying to help the families and individuals caught up in them. DS Jenn Townsend returns to work following her father's death and has to push her own grief aside as she investigates the murder of a young woman

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Oscars Live
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross hosts full coverage of the 97th Academy Awards, joined by guests including actor Jacon Isaacs, broadcaster Mariella Frostrup and film expert Elle Osili-Wood. Jonathan also presents footage from the red carpet at the Dolby Theatre in LA with Ross King, before the live ceremony begins at midnight, UK time, hosted by US TV host and comedian Conan O'Brien

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chefs Yvonne Cobb and Rupy Aujla at Tyntesfield in Somerset to see who can create and cook the Dish of the Day this time. Ainsley collects greengages and plums for his brioche French toast, chargrilled plums and cinnamon creme fraiche, Yvonne adds delicious flavour hacks to a creamy tarragon chicken and French bean salad with roasted rosemary potatoes, and Rupy talks up the health benefits of his grilled mackerel, roasted apple, radish and chilli and pea pesto

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur shares her passion for good food and recipes for an aubergine and potato curry with fresh roti, a salmon and tomato curry and gooey brownies. Plus, a lesson in how to handle alpacas and a visit from a local chainsaw artist

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Tour de Fred: Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix embarks on a gastronomic cycling tour of Northern Ireland to discover the region's best-kept delicious secrets. He begins in the Mourne Mountains where he pushes himself to cycle up to Spelga Dam for the best panoramic views and fuels up with a traditional Ulster Fry

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are married couple Jon and Nicola, student housemates Caitlin and Emily, and bookmaker's manager Vicky and her partner Andy

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chris from Manchester, Julie from Solihull, Maggie from Llandudno and Ed from London pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Jenn and the team worry that Manning released information from their enquiries to the public too soon when Hannah's boyfriend Cal is discovered near death. At home, tensions brew as Jenn tries to juggle the investigation and her relationship with Chris

programme.title: My Family

programme.title: My Family

programme.title: Outnumbered

programme.title: Porridge
